link.title: Randolph County School System: District News

div.aria-label: Meals for Kids during the COVID-19 School Break News Post
div.h3: Meals for Kids during the COVID-19 School Break
div.p: A PDF document is attached that details locations for meal pickup during the school break. This service is being coordinated by the Alabama Cooperative Extension System.

div.strong: MEALS FOR KIDS DURING THE COVID‐19 SCHOOL BREAK

div.div: Where: Rock Mills First United Methodist Church ‐ 66059 AL‐22, Roanoke, AL 36274
When: Monday, Wednesday, and Friday – 11 am – 12 pm
What to do: “Grab and go” drive through service – Parent and child to pickup.
Who: Meals available for any child under the age of 18 – lunch for the day and snack for the
following day
Contact: Magen McCarley – 256‐225‐3039
Where: Wadley First Baptist Church – 396 Highland Ave Wadley Al 36276
When: Monday, Wednesday, and Friday – 11 am – 12 pm
What to do: “Grab and go” drive through service – Parent and child to pickup.
Who: Meals available for any child under the age of 18 – lunch for the day and snack for the
following day
Contact: Paul Wilson – 205 ‐ 789 ‐ 9501
Where: Wedowee First Baptist Church – 520 Hillcrest Ave Wedowee Alabama 36278
When: Monday, Wednesday, and Friday – 11 am – 12 pm
What to do: “Grab and go” drive through service – Parent and child to pickup.
Who: Meals available for any child under the age of 18 – lunch for the day and snack for the
following day
Contact: Jamie Wells – 205‐516‐4474
Where: Woodland Bear Creek United Methodist – 23980 Highway 48 Woodland Al 36280
When: Monday, Wednesday, and Friday – 11 am – 12 pm
What to do: “Grab and go” drive through service – Parent and child to pickup.
Who: Meals available for any child under the age of 18 – lunch for the day and snack for the
following day
Contact: Rita Shelton – 256‐506‐0427
182 Circle Drive, Wedowee, AL 36278
div.p:
The Randolph County Board of Education does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, or age in its programs and activities and provides equal access to Boy Scouts of America and other designated youth groups. The following people have been designated to handle inquiries regarding
the non-discrimination policies:
Beth Bailey, Section 504 Coordinator 256-357-4611 x.2012
Mary Kelly, Title IX Coordinator 256-357-4611 x.2011
Beth Bailey, Title II/Special Needs Coordinator 256-357-4611 x.2012
John Jacobs, ADA Coordinator 256-357-4611 x.2002
